title_sort: harry stafford to walt whitman, 13 november 1877
title: Harry Stafford to Walt Whitman, 13 November 1877
text: Kirkwood N.J.New JerseyNovembNovember 13 Dear friend Waltâ€”Father has been very sick and wishes to see you very badly, he toled[told] me to stop and tell you Yesterday but I did not find you in when I was there so I thought that I would write a few lines to you; the first thing that he asked me when I got home was if I had seen you. We thought he was dying Saturday night for a time. I had to go after the doctor about 12 o'clock you must come down as soon as you get this letter, come down on the 4 train from PhilaPhiladelphia tomorrow if you can any how I will have to close for the present.Ever yoursHarry Stafford Harry Stafford to Walt Whitman, 13 November 1877
